triples.name: Fuzzy logic
triples.relevance: Fuzzy logic is used as the foundation for designing the fuzzy state observer to estimate unmeasurable states.

triples.name: Backstepping
triples.relevance: Backstepping is the core control design technique used in the adaptive recursive design for strict-feedback nonlinear systems.

triples.name: Lyapunov function
triples.relevance: Lyapunov functions are constructed to prove stability of the closed-loop system in the control design framework.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: Adaptive control techniques are employed to handle unknown virtual and actual control gain functions in the system.

triples.name: Nonlinear system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control design for uncertain strict-feedback nonlinear systems as the main problem domain.

triples.name: State observer
triples.relevance: A novel fuzzy state observer is designed to estimate unmeasurable states from available measurements.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Control theory principles including feedback and tracking are foundational to the proposed control method.
